subject: amperecpu: Scan CPU sensors in the first power on
commitMessage:
amperecpu: Scan CPU sensors in the first power on

The Altra SMPro-hwmon driver is probed when BMC boot up, but it is
only binded when the host is Running. This causes the CPU sensor paths
are not available when the bmc boots up with the host is off. The
Ampere CPU daemon will not create any host sensor dbus objects.

In the first power on time of the host, when the CurrentHostState
powered is "...HostState.Running", the SMPro-hwmon drivers are binded.
The host sensors paths are created. The AmpereSoc daemon will scan the
CPU sensor paths and create the host sensor dbus objects.

Tested:
    1. Boot up the openbmc with the host is off.
    2. Object xyz.openbmc_project.AmpereCPUSensor should be empty.
    3. Turn on the host, wait for the Running state of the host.
    4. The xyz.openbmc_project.AmpereCPUSensor Dbus interface will
       list the CPU sensors.

Signed-off-by: ThuBaNguyen <thu@os.amperecomputing.com>
Change-Id: I305d600c16d58fe5c44c72fc2452c26910d64393

Patch Set 4:

I just update the mechanism in creating the host sensors.
The sensors will only be scanned one time at the fist power on of the host.

When BMC boot up with the host, the host hwmon drivers are not binded so the sensor's paths are not available. The amperecpusensor daemon can't create the host sensors at this moment. 
When the host is on, the host drivers are binded, the host sensors will be created.

Patch Set 21:

(5 comments)
Considering entity-manager is generally doing the binding, that doesn't seem like it would be the case.  Is there more background here?

As my understanding, the entity-manager will probe the device base on the FRU info which it got from Fru EEPROM in that device. Our Altras don't have Fru only the chassis have Fru EEPROM.

When Bmc boots up with the host is off, the Altra drivers were not bind, they are probed but no sensor paths are created.
The drivers only are binded when the Altra chip are already On which identify by the CurrentHostState. At this moment, the sensor paths are available. The AmperCPUSensor daemon has to rescan the sensors.
Ack

This seems like a problem for dbus interfaces.  Unless there's runtime data needed to make the sensors (which I don't see in this daemons current form) we should be creating the interfaces at all times.
I don't see any problem with the dbus interface here, the sensors interfaces are not created because the sensor paths are not available.
Ack

This is one thing I'm not quite following, given this is the ampere CPU daemon, don't we know all the paths upfront?  The scanning code looks like it was copied from PSU sensor, but wouldn't be needed in this case, where we know exactly what paths will exist at compile time.

We knew the path, but at the first scan when BMC boot up with the host is off, the path is not available because the Altra driver is not binded.
One more case, in 2P system, when the host boots up with only 1 CPU, the second CPU is failed to boot. Only one sensor path is created. In this case only one driver is binded. At the next boot, 2 CPU boot normally, then there are 2 Altra drivers, one for CPU1 and one for CPU2.
Ack
Please do an exact match on the full enum.
Yes, I'm updating code.
Updated code.

After an AC cycle, the host sensors objects were not created, but a BMC reboot will have the host sensors populated. However, when amperecpusensor is delayed by the filter timer, we see the cpu sensors getting populated.

Hi Avenash,
Can you give more information about filter timer?
Below is some information:
When BMC is rebooted while the Host is ON, as the Altra Host is currently ON, the driver can be probed. But in the case of A/C, as the Altra Host is not ON, smpro-hwmon driver will probe fail and you need to manually bind the HWMON device. Refer to https://github.com/ampere-openbmc/openbmc/blob/ampere/meta-ampere/meta-jade/recipes-ampere/platform/mtjade-utils/ampere_driver_binder.sh.
You can find in our implementation, after S0_FW_BOOT_OK is asserted, we delay 5s before binding the driver to ensure all sensor devices are available. But it is from the Altra sensor, not dbus-sensor's AmpereCPU

Hi Thang,
The filterTimer I am referencing is from the comment #801 from patchset 3.
The solution to this will have to be resolved externally and so the code is good to be merged from our side.
Ack

This block doesn't track for me.  We should not be rearming the filter timer, and shouldn't be re-calling createSensors, which will create sensors every time the host boots, instead of only the first time.

I suspect this needs an abstraction to create the sensors at all times, but only read them when the host is on, like the other sensors in this space do.

Because there are no sensor paths until the host is on and the CPU drivers are binded. So we need rescan the host sensors each the boot time of host.
The number of the CPU drivers can be difference between the boot time and the number of sensors in the driver can be different too. It is depend on the number of device is plugged in CPU peripheral interfaces.

About the filter timer, I will check it.
Removed the block.
Ack

Question:

Will property change signal also be received when host becomes on? 

I want to know if there is a possibility that create sensor is called two times for same sensor.
The createdSensors flag will prevent that.
Done

Question,
Why this change?

"In the first power on time of the host, when the CurrentHostState
powered is "...HostState.Running", the SMPro-hwmon drivers are binded.
The host sensors paths are created. The AmpereSoc daemon will scan the
CPU sensor paths and create the host sensor dbus objects." we will only create the host sensor at the first time power on of the host.
